definition: a steady flow (idiom); an unending stream
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Most importantly the support continues to roll in.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，這些捐助在源源不斷地大量輸往海地。

sentences.english: However, claims from the descendants of Greek victims continued to be made.
sentences.chinese: 然而，來自希臘受害者後人的賠償要求仍源源不斷。

sentences.english: Through this pipeline, crude oil flows from Daqing to Beijing in a steady stream.
sentences.chinese: 大慶石油通過這條輸油管源源不斷地流往北京。

sentences.english: She had a bottomless well of love for me.
sentences.chinese: 她有一座無底的井，對我源源不斷流出愛。

sentences.english: You will also get referrals and repeat orders (Becasue you are the super COOL person that is real).
sentences.chinese: 你也會獲得別人的推薦和源源不斷的訂單。

sentences.english: By so doing, generations of Hui merchants have ceaselessly directed wealth into their home villages.
sentences.chinese: 世世代代的徽商就是這樣讓財富源源不斷流向故鄉的。

sentences.english: Manufactured goods from Asia keep flowing into this natural ice-free harbor throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲的產品一年四季源源不斷地運入這座天然不凍港。

sentences.english: See a steady stream of guests who consistently become members.
sentences.chinese: 眼見源源不斷的來賓終於成爲會員。

sentences.english: In the meantime, the steady stream of NorthKorean defectors continues to flow into Chiang Saen.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，源源不斷的朝鮮逃難者繼續湧向清盛。

sentences.english: The never-ending reports of what he was doing always got me psyched.
sentences.chinese: 關於他的源源不斷的報道，總是讓我癡狂。

sentences.english: This constant beverage use increases the risk of tooth decay.
sentences.chinese: 這些源源不斷地軟飲料增加了牙齒腐爛的風險。

sentences.english: His bottom-up approach tapped a wellspring of money and votes.
sentences.chinese: 他自下而上的辦法帶來了源源不斷的金錢和投票。

sentences.english: Foreign words keep coming into English.
sentences.chinese: 外來詞源源不斷地進入英語。

sentences.english: She kept us supplied with food and money.
sentences.chinese: 她爲我們源源不斷提供食物和錢。

sentences.english: He’s partnered with a team of writers to keep you supplied with a constant stream of remarkable posts.
sentences.chinese: 他和一組作者合作，爲你提供源源不斷的精彩文章。

sentences.english: Aid continues to pour into the devastated country.
sentences.chinese: 救災物資繼續源源不斷湧入受災國。

definition: to flow/to circulate/to go from place to place/to be mobile/(of assets) liquid
copious/plentiful (of water)/surging (of waves)/refers to home village of first Han emperor 漢高祖|汉高祖[Han4 Gao1 zu3]/fig. majestic
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
Ziyuan county in Guilin 桂林[Gui4 lin2], Guangxi
natural resource (such as water or minerals)/resource (such as manpower or tourism)
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
